channel.title: Arturia Minilab / Beatstep
channel.description:
I have a Minilab for testing here and realized I can only get LED feedback from the buttons via Sysex.
I found out that for the Beatstep it's the same. I was wondering if anybody here invested in getting this to work with axoloti.
As of here it seems that axoloti can send out sysex: http://community.axoloti.com/t/ableton-push-controlling-axoloti/248/30
EDIT: I just emailed Arturia for the sysex implementation. In case they send it to me would share it here in any case.

item.title: Arturia Minilab / Beatstep
item.dc:creator: @trimardius
item.description:
@trimardius wrote:

I am working on a synth loop-station thing and currently have no feedback on the record/toggle/etc status on my Minilab.
Your object will surely help me to 'bring light' on my Minilab!
Thanks for that!

Read full topic

item.title: Arturia Minilab / Beatstep
item.dc:creator: @reubenfinger
item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

Thanks so much for this, I am for the most part a noncoder, I try here and there, but I have been picking away at a sysex object in Axo to send, for example an LFO to my Alpha Juno/Matrix 1000, hopefully I can use your object as the basis for one of my own...again Thanks a lot for sharing

Read full topic

item.title: Arturia Minilab / Beatstep
item.dc:creator: @gonp
item.description:
@gonp wrote:

Hi,

there is a lot of info on beatstep sysex codes here:

untergeek.de

Taming Arturia's Beatstep: Sysex codes for programming via iPad - untergeek

Nice. New. Toy. Arturia’s Beatstep controller is a steal for 99 Euros – it just feels great. Large, solid pads, smooth, reassuring encoders. Did I mention there’s a 16-step sequencer included? And a CV/gate interface? Must-have. I sold my QuNexus …...

I have been using these codes to set pad leds from the axo. I am using a beatstep, connected directly to the axo usb host port.

here is an example object/patch that shows how to do it:
bs_sysex.axp (2.6 KB)

Read full topic

item.title: Arturia Minilab / Beatstep
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

I have a Minilab for testing here and realized I can only get LED feedback from the buttons via Sysex.

I found out that for the Beatstep it's the same. I was wondering if anybody here invested in getting this to work with axoloti.

As of here it seems that axoloti can send out sysex:

Ableton Push controlling Axoloti

sorry guys busy on other projects at the moment. @Hugo its a while since i read the code. I think this will be problematic, since the parameter table it uses, I dont think knows anything about the hierarchy of objects/patches. there are 2 changes probably for the future: a) parameter need to have more meta data/stucture b) custom objects for push, to allow the UI to be 'explicitly' designed. (a) is need for axoloti control , so is likely to happen, then the Push object will need updating. (…

EDIT:
I just emailed Arturia for the sysex implementation. In case they send it to me would share it here in any case.

Read full topic
